docs.snippet: A steadying influence was imparted to British sterling last mid-week on the statement of Chancellor of the Exchequer Butler that with aid from the United States and readjustment of her armament program, Britain can expect to balance her trade with...
docs.lead_paragraph: A steadying influence was imparted to British sterling last mid-week on the statement of Chancellor of the Exchequer Butler that with aid from the United States and readjustment of her armament program, Britain can expect to balance her trade with the world in the second half of 1952, after having overspent for the last two years.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended August 1, 1952

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, Aug 5 (UP) -- President Manuel Odria swore in a new Cabinet today to succeed the one that resigned Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, Aug 5 (UP) -- President Manuel Odria swore in a new Cabinet today to succeed the one that resigned Saturday.

headline.main: PERU CABINET SWORN IN; General Noriega Heads Ministry as Premier and War Chief

docs.snippet: Radioteletype service to the leading newspapers and radio stations of Latin America and the West Indies was started yesterday by The Associated Press to provide faster and more complete news reports to members in that region. They have been receiving...
docs.lead_paragraph: Radioteletype service to the leading newspapers and radio stations of Latin America and the West Indies was started yesterday by The Associated Press to provide faster and more complete news reports to members in that region. They have been receiving the news by Morse wireless.
docs.abstract: AP opens radioteletype service to newspapers in Latin Amer and W Indies

headline.main: LATIN AMERICA TO GET RADIOTELETYPE NEWS

docs.snippet: With a 150 per cent increase in imports of Uruguayan wool tops, the Secretary of the Treasury can no longer ignore the demand of American wool combers to impose a countervailing duty justified by Uruguayan subsidies, according to Ames Stevens,...
docs.lead_paragraph: With a 150 per cent increase in imports of Uruguayan wool tops, the Secretary of the Treasury can no longer ignore the demand of American wool combers to impose a countervailing duty justified by Uruguayan subsidies, according to Ames Stevens, president of the National Association of Wool Manufacturers.
docs.abstract: Natl Wool Mrs Assn urges action on US wool combers demands for duty rise on Uruguayan imports; notes peril to US indus; cites May receipts

headline.main: WOOL GROUP URGES INCREASED TARIFF; Uruguayan Subsidy and 150 % Rise in Imports Justify Move, N. A. W. M. Head Says

docs.snippet: Formal wage review negotiations between employers and the International Longshoremen's Association, A. F. L., will open today, with the union seeking a 24 per cent hourly wage increase. The meeting will be held at 11 A. M. in the offices of the New...
docs.lead_paragraph: Formal wage review negotiations between employers and the International Longshoremen's Association, A. F. L., will open today, with the union seeking a 24 per cent hourly wage increase. The meeting will be held at 11 A. M. in the offices of the New York Shipping Association, which represents the majority of the stevedoring concerns on the North Atlantic Coast, at 80 Broad Street.
docs.abstract: A V Moore on gen dip

headline.main: NEWS OF INTEREST IN SHIPPING WORLD; I. L. A. Seeks 24% Pay Rise as Review Opens Today -- Moore Cites Slump

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 -- John D. Hickerson. Assistant Secretary of State, today told the International Geographical Union that the modern science of geography could contribute much "to that stability and progress which a future of peace and justice...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 -- John D. Hickerson. Assistant Secretary of State, today told the International Geographical Union that the modern science of geography could contribute much "to that stability and progress which a future of peace and justice demands."
docs.abstract: Asst Sec Hickerson cites geog science's role

headline.main: GEOGRAPHY'S ROLE FOR PEACE IS CITED; Assistant Secretary of State Declares It Can Contribute Much to Stability, Progress WORLD GROUP CONVENES Hears Hickerson Urge Closer Cooperation Between the Scientists and Diplomats

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Moore - McCormack liner Uruguay struck a submerged object 230 miles from New York yesterday morning, disabling one of her two propellers. The collision caused an "excessive vibration'' and induced the line to divert the ship to Newport News, Va.,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Moore - McCormack liner Uruguay struck a submerged object 230 miles from New York yesterday morning, disabling one of her two propellers. The collision caused an "excessive vibration'' and induced the line to divert the ship to Newport News, Va., for replacement of the damaged blade.
docs.abstract: Uruguay (SS): strikes submerged object 230 mi from NYC; heads for Newport News for repairs

headline.main: LINER URUGUAY HITS A SUBMERGED OBJECT

docs.snippet: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., Aug. 10 -- The 30,000-ton liner Uruguay, which went into drydock at the Newport News Shipbuilding and Drydock Company late last night for emergency repairs, should be able to continue her voyage about 7 P. M. today.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., Aug. 10 -- The 30,000-ton liner Uruguay, which went into drydock at the Newport News Shipbuilding and Drydock Company late last night for emergency repairs, should be able to continue her voyage about 7 P. M. today.
docs.abstract: SS Uruguay (Moore-McCormack) in drydock for emergency repairs after striking submerged object at sea

headline.main: 322 Are Entertained As Liner Is Repaired

docs.snippet: The Canadian dollar soared to a new high premium in terms of its American counterpart when it sold at a 4 7/32 cent, last Wednesday. This was the highest since November 1933, when it touched 4 9/16 cent, for the record.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian dollar soared to a new high premium in terms of its American counterpart when it sold at a 4 7/32 cent, last Wednesday. This was the highest since November 1933, when it touched 4 9/16 cent, for the record.
